titles.title: Proposing an amendment to the Constitution relating to a Federal balanced budget.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic and Commercial Law.

bill.summary: 1/6/1993--Introduced. Constitutional Amendment - Prohibits in any fiscal year total Federal outlays from exceeding total receipts, unless a three-fifths vote of both Houses authorizes a specific excess. Directs the President to submit a balanced budget to the Congress. Waives these provisions when a declaration of war is in effect.
